title: Quantum computing approach to realistic ESG-friendly stock portfolios
abstract: arXiv:2404.02582v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Finding an optimal balance between risk and returns in investment portfolios is a central challenge in quantitative finance, often addressed through Markowitz portfolio theory (MPT). While traditional portfolio optimization is carried out in a continuous fashion, as if stocks could be bought in fractional increments, practical implementations often resort to approximations, as fractional stocks are typically not tradeable. While these approximations are effective for large investment budgets, they deteriorate as budgets decrease. To alleviate this issue, a discrete Markowitz portfolio theory (DMPT) with finite budgets and integer stock weights can be formulated, but results in a non-polynomial (NP)-hard problem. Recent progress in quantum processing units (QPUs), including quantum annealers, makes solving DMPT problems feasible. translated_title: 量子计算方法应用于现实ESG友好型股票组合
translated_abstract: 寻找在投资组合中风险和回报之间的最佳平衡是量化金融中的一个核心挑战，通常通过马科维茨组合理论（MPT）来解决。本研究探讨了量子退火机在投资组合优化中的应用，建立了连续和离散马科维茨组合理论之间的映射关系，提出了一种解决离散马科维茨组合理论问题的方法。
tldr: 本研究在量子退火机上探索了投资组合优化，建立了连续和离散马科维茨组合理论之间的映射关系。
en_tdlr: This study explores portfolio optimization on quantum annealers, establishing a mapping between continuous and discrete Markowitz portfolio theory.
